intro: Quamoclit oculatus, commonly known as the eye-flower or eye-plant, is a unique member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, orb-shaped inflorescences that resemble eyes, hence its common name. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Quamoclit oculatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
